data.title: Senior Commercial Asset Manager
data.description:
Senior Commercial Asset Manager

Location: Germany

Company: ILOS Projects GmbH

Scope: Full-time – some office presence required.

WHO ARE ILOS?

ILOS is a fast-growing renewable energy company with a strong presence across Europe, backed by AXA IM Alts and committed to accelerating the energy transition. Since 2018, we have developed, built, and operated large-scale solar PV projects across seven core markets.

THE ROLE OVERVIEW

The candidate will be responsible for (day-to-day) commercial & financial management of our international operating asset portfolio. This role will work closely with our senior technical asset manager and commercial asset managers based in various European regions. Our current operational solar portfolio extends across Germany, Ireland, Italy and the UK.

TASKS

  • Lead the commercial and administrative management of a multi-country European solar PV portfolio.
  • Manage, coach and develop a team of regional Commercial Asset Managers, setting priorities and KPIs, harmonising processes and tools across countries, and ensuring high-quality execution at local level.
  • Oversee the full lifecycle and performance of key contracts, ensuring obligations, deliverables and reporting requirements are met and optimised.
  • Own the preparation, consolidation and control of annual budgets, long-term financial plans, cash management and periodic variance analysis, defining and driving corrective actions to protect and enhance returns.
  • Lead monthly and quarterly reporting to senior management and investors, ensuring robust financial and KPI analysis, and act as key interface with Finance for accounting, tax, treasury, controlling, financial statements and portfolio valuations.
  • Ensure strong governance and compliance with statutory, contractual, financing and corporate requirements across all SPVs.
  • Build and maintain senior-level relationships with investors, lenders, off takers and key suppliers, acting as primary senior point of contact for operational matters and ensuring transparent, proactive communication.
  • Review and approve new asset management commercial offers and service proposals to ensure commercial robustness, competitiveness and alignment with company strategy and investor expectations.

PROFILE

  • University degree in Finance, Business, Engineering, Economics or a related discipline.
  • 5+ years’ experience in energy/infrastructure asset management, including at least 5 years in renewable energy and proven utility-scale solar PV portfolio management.
  • Demonstrated experience managing SPVs and portfolios across multiple European countries, with hands-on responsibility for commercial asset performance.
  • Solid understanding of project finance structures, financial covenants and lender/investor reporting.
  • Strong financial acumen: budgeting, variance analysis, cash flow modelling, P&L management and value-creation mindset.
  • Excellent contract management skills, including risk identification, mitigation and optimisation of commercial terms.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a data-driven approach to decision-making.
  • Proven international team leadership, stakeholder management and clear communication skills, including presentations to senior management and external counterparties.
  • Solid understanding of European power markets and renewable energy regulation; advanced Excel and strong MS Office skills (experience with asset management/reporting tools a plus).
  • Fluent business German & English; additional European languages an advantage; willingness to travel regularly across Europe

Become part of a committed team shaping the future of clean energy, together.

CONTACT

Do you have questions about your career at ILOS? We’re here for you!

Whether it's about open positions, the application process, or our work environment – our HR team will be happy to support you.

Contact our Talent Acquisition Manager, Toby Barbieri – Find Jobs in Germany on Arbeitnow

data.description:
We dig Web3.

WeAreShovels.com is a Web3 engineering studio building and securing production-grade Web3 protocols, infrastructure, and tooling. We help Web3 builders dig deep, uncover value, and ship Web3 products that last - fast.

We’re looking for a Senior Web3 Frontend Engineer (Lead) who enjoys building great interfaces, leading others, and helping customers succeed.

Tasks

What you’ll do

Requirements

Benefits

  • Top-tier, highly interesting projects — from top-100 market-cap chains to $100M+ funded perpetual futures exchange

If you like digging deep, leading by example, and being a reliable tool in crafting Web3 success - we’d love to work with you.

data.title: Station Agent (m/w/d) in Teilzeit
data.description:
Bei Flix bieten wir ein dynamisches Arbeitsumfeld mit konkurrenzfähiger Bezahlung, guten Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten und einem technologieorientierten Ansatz, der Reisen zugänglicher, nachhaltiger und erschwinglicher macht.  

Als Kundenberater bei Flix kannst du einen Unterschied machen, indem du unseren Fahrgästen am Standort Dresden ein reibungsloses und unterstützendes Reiseerlebnis bietest – von der Ticketberatung bis zum Check-in. 

Werde Teil unseres engagierten Teams in Dresden und unterstütze uns dabei, ein erstklassiges Kundenerlebnis direkt vor Ort zu schaffen. Wir arbeiten mit Leidenschaft daran, unseren Gästen den besten Service zu bieten – mit einem Lächeln, guter Organisation und einem starken Teamgeist. 

Diese Stelle ist zunächst auf ein Jahr befristet (Elternzeitvertretung) und bietet die Möglichkeit einer Verlängerung.

Über die Rolle

  • Berate unsere Kunden und Fahrgäste freundlich und kompetent im FlixShop in Dresden
  • Verkaufe Tickets und informiere über das Flix-Angebot
  • Sichere einen reibungslosen Ablauf vor den Busabfahrten
  • Koordiniere aktiv Fahrgäste und unterstütze beim Check-In
  • Verteile Informationsmaterial wie Flyer und Magazine an unsere Busse
  • Gestalte aktiv ein positives Kundenerlebnis vor Ort
  • Trage zur stetigen Verbesserung unserer Abläufe bei

Über dich

  • Verfügbar bist du für eine Teilzeitstelle (30 Stunde / Woche) oder auf Minijob basis
  • Idealerweise hast du bereits Erfahrung im Kundenservice, Einzelhandel, am Flughafen oder in vergleichbaren Bereichen gesammelt
  • Gute Deutschkenntnisse bringst du bereits mit, erste Englischkenntnisse sind ebenfalls von Vorteil
  • Mit PC, Internet und E-Mail-Kommunikation gehst du sicher und routiniert um
  • Als serviceorientierte und kommunikationsstarke Persönlichkeit trittst du stets gepflegt auf
  • Auch in stressigen Momenten bewahrst du Ruhe und den Überblick

Wir wissen, dass jede*r einzigartige Erfahrungen mitbringt. Auch wenn du nicht alle Anforderungen erfüllst, möchten wir dich ermutigen, dich trotzdem zu bewerben. Wir freuen uns darauf, von dir zu hören!

Was wir bieten

  • Reisevorteile: 12 kostenlose Flix-Reisegutscheine + 12 Rabattgutscheine für Freunde & Familie
  • Arbeitsmodelle mit Flexibilität: Fester Schichtplan mit Teilzeitmodell für eine gute Work-Life-Balance
  • Gesundheit & Wohlbefinden: Kostenlose Coachings & Therapiesitzungen über OpenUp
  • Lernen & Entwicklung: Bezahlte Schulungen, Sprachkurse, interne Trainings & Mentoring-Programme
  • Vergünstigungen: Urban Sports Club (85 %), Deutschlandticket (30 %), Corporate Benefits-Portal mit Rabatten auf viele Lebensbereiche
  • Teamkultur: Ein diverses, unterstützendes Arbeitsumfeld mit starkem Teamspirit und Raum für eigene Ideen

Eine Übersicht über standortspezifische Zusatzleistungen findest du hier: Locations - Flix Career

Warum Flix?

Bei Flix erwarten dich Teams, die gemeinsam anpacken, Herausforderungen meistern und kreative Lösungen finden. Wir leben eine Kultur des Vertrauens und der Eigenverantwortung – du bekommst bei uns den Freiraum, eigene Ideen umzusetzen, wirklich etwas zu bewegen und deinen Karriereweg aktiv mitzugestalten.

Während wir weiter international wachsen, hast du die Chance, einen echten Unterschied zu machen – für uns, unsere Fahrgäste und die Zukunft der Mobilität.

Wenn du bereit bist, über dich hinauszuwachsen und deine Reise bei uns zu starten, dann ist Flix genau der richtige Ort für dich!

data.title: Working Student - Legal (m/f/d)
data.description:
At Flix, we offer a dynamic work environment with competitive pay, strong growth opportunities, and a tech-driven approach to making travel more accessible, sustainable, and affordable.  

We are looking for a Working Student - Legal (m/f/d) with knowledge of German law to join our Legal team. You will work 20 hours per week and support the team with legal tasks, including legal research, reviewing and drafting lease agreements, preparing letters to the court, and handling various administrative duties.

About the Role

  • You will support the Legal & Integrity department in all legal matters and in the daily business of contract management
  • You will assist other departments in using and handling our Legal Tech applications
  • You will analyze relevant legislation and stay up to date with current case law
  • You will research legal issues, analyze them, and prepare the results
  • You will independently handle various internal and external legal inquiries

About You

  • You are currently enrolled in a law program that leads to the First or Second State Examination
  • You have initial practical experience or a strong interest in civil law
  • You enjoy and have an interest in Legal Tech applications
  • You have excellent MS Office skills
  • You are quick to grasp new concepts and think analytically
  • You work in a solution-oriented, independent, and conscientious manner
  • You are a team player with enthusiasm for legal topics and a technical mindset
  • You are friendly, communicative, and motivated
  • You are fluent in German and English

We recognize that everyone carries a unique set of valuable skills and experiences. If you think you could have an impact even though you don't meet 100% of the requirements, we still encourage you to apply. We want to hear from you!  

What We Offer

  • Travel perks: 12 free Flix vouchers + 12 discount vouchers for friends & family. 
  • Wellbeing support: Access confidential 1:1 counselling, courses, and stress management for yourself and up to four family members. 
  • Learning & Development: Take advantage of language classes, training courses, and expert-led sessions to grow your skills. 
  • Mentoring Program: Connect with experienced colleagues to gain insights and accelerate your career. 

To view more local benefits specific to each office location, please check out this link: Locations - Flix Career

Why Join Flix?

At Flix, you'll find teams that rally together to overcome challenges and spark creativity. We believe in ownership culture - giving you the freedom to take initiative, make an impact, and shape your own career path.
As we continue to expand across the globe, you can make a real difference in how we work.

If you're ready to grow and lead your journey, Flix is the place for you!

data.title: Shop Mitarbeiter (m/w/d) in Teilzeit
data.description:
Bei Flix bieten wir ein dynamisches Arbeitsumfeld mit konkurrenzfähiger Bezahlung, guten Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten und einem technologieorientierten Ansatz, der Reisen zugänglicher, nachhaltiger und erschwinglicher macht.  

Als Kundenberater bei Flix kannst du einen Unterschied machen, indem du unseren Fahrgästen am Standort Dresden ein reibungsloses und unterstützendes Reiseerlebnis bietest – von der Ticketberatung bis zum Check-in. 

Werde Teil unseres engagierten Teams in Dresden und unterstütze uns dabei, ein erstklassiges Kundenerlebnis direkt vor Ort zu schaffen. Wir arbeiten mit Leidenschaft daran, unseren Gästen den besten Service zu bieten – mit einem Lächeln, guter Organisation und einem starken Teamgeist. 

Diese Stelle ist zunächst auf ein Jahr befristet (Elternzeitvertretung) und bietet die Möglichkeit einer Verlängerung.

Über die Rolle

  • Berate unsere Kunden und Fahrgäste freundlich und kompetent im FlixShop in Dresden
  • Verkaufe Tickets und informiere über das Flix-Angebot
  • Sichere einen reibungslosen Ablauf vor den Busabfahrten
  • Koordiniere aktiv Fahrgäste und unterstütze beim Check-In
  • Verteile Informationsmaterial wie Flyer und Magazine an unsere Busse
  • Gestalte aktiv ein positives Kundenerlebnis vor Ort
  • Trage zur stetigen Verbesserung unserer Abläufe bei

Über dich

  • Verfügbar bist du für eine Teilzeitstelle (30 Stunde / Woche) oder auf Minijob basis
  • Idealerweise hast du bereits Erfahrung im Kundenservice, Einzelhandel, am Flughafen oder in vergleichbaren Bereichen gesammelt
  • Gute Deutschkenntnisse bringst du bereits mit, erste Englischkenntnisse sind ebenfalls von Vorteil
  • Mit PC, Internet und E-Mail-Kommunikation gehst du sicher und routiniert um
  • Als serviceorientierte und kommunikationsstarke Persönlichkeit trittst du stets gepflegt auf
  • Auch in stressigen Momenten bewahrst du Ruhe und den Überblick

Wir wissen, dass jede*r einzigartige Erfahrungen mitbringt. Auch wenn du nicht alle Anforderungen erfüllst, möchten wir dich ermutigen, dich trotzdem zu bewerben. Wir freuen uns darauf, von dir zu hören!

Was wir bieten

  • Reisevorteile: 12 kostenlose Flix-Reisegutscheine + 12 Rabattgutscheine für Freunde & Familie
  • Arbeitsmodelle mit Flexibilität: Fester Schichtplan mit Teilzeitmodell für eine gute Work-Life-Balance
  • Gesundheit & Wohlbefinden: Kostenlose Coachings & Therapiesitzungen über OpenUp
  • Lernen & Entwicklung: Bezahlte Schulungen, Sprachkurse, interne Trainings & Mentoring-Programme
  • Vergünstigungen: Urban Sports Club (85 %), Deutschlandticket (30 %), Corporate Benefits-Portal mit Rabatten auf viele Lebensbereiche
  • Teamkultur: Ein diverses, unterstützendes Arbeitsumfeld mit starkem Teamspirit und Raum für eigene Ideen

Eine Übersicht über standortspezifische Zusatzleistungen findest du hier: Locations - Flix Career

Warum Flix?

Bei Flix erwarten dich Teams, die gemeinsam anpacken, Herausforderungen meistern und kreative Lösungen finden. Wir leben eine Kultur des Vertrauens und der Eigenverantwortung – du bekommst bei uns den Freiraum, eigene Ideen umzusetzen, wirklich etwas zu bewegen und deinen Karriereweg aktiv mitzugestalten.

Während wir weiter international wachsen, hast du die Chance, einen echten Unterschied zu machen – für uns, unsere Fahrgäste und die Zukunft der Mobilität.

Wenn du bereit bist, über dich hinauszuwachsen und deine Reise bei uns zu starten, dann ist Flix genau der richtige Ort für dich!

data.title: Account Manager - German Speaker (m/f/x)
data.description:
Atolls is the world's largest community-driven shopping platform, active in 20+ markets. 

We help millions make smarter spending decisions across discovery, evaluation, and (re-)purchase by connecting people with the right brands and retailers.

Our 1,000+ team across 10 countries builds products used every day at global scale, where you'll have real ownership and see your impact. Want to shape the destinations people rely on to shop with confidence? Keep reading.

About This Role:

We are looking for an Account Manager (m/f/x) - German Speaker to join our Account Management team in Berlin or Munich. At Atolls, your role will be instrumental in helping us to grow our German Market for the Publisher Verticals Cashback, Community and Voucher, creating exceptional user experiences and empowering consumers to make informed and confident shopping decisions. As a key part of our team, you'll be directly involved in building and enhancing the digital destinations our users rely on throughout their shopping journeys.

Your contributions will help shape how millions of consumers interact with our platforms, guiding them to make smart, fair, and rewarding choices.

Our Benefits:

At Atolls, we believe in nurturing both your professional and personal growth. Here's what you can expect:

    •    A culture that values personal and professional development, with internal mobility opportunities.
    •    A supportive and open-minded team that embraces diverse perspectives and innovative ideas.
    •    32 days of paid vacation plus your birthday off, giving you the time you need to recharge.
    •    A flexible hybrid working scheme to balance work and life.
    •    Access to a learning budget and internal training to help you grow in your role.
    •    Mental health coaching to support your well-being.
    •    Regular global and local get-togethers to celebrate successes and build connections.
    •    The possibility of taking a sabbatical after two years with the company.
    •    A cloud-based company setup, providing flexibility and collaboration opportunities no matter where you are.

*These are global benefits that apply to all employees, with additional local perks based on your location.

Responsibilities:

In this role, you will:

  • Develop and negotiate long-term agreements with your clients.
  • Collaborate and build close cooperation with your retailers to understand their business goals.
  • Provide strategic guidance based on data analysis to optimize partner campaigns.
  • Identify opportunities for solution expansions and new campaigns.
  • Represent and act as the face of the company in negotiations, events and conferences.
  • Educate partners on the use of the company's solutions and new features.
  • Regularly assess partner performance against goals and continuously monitor and report on campaign performance.
  • Maintain open and regular communication with partners and address any challenges promptly and effectively.
  • Share updates on the progress and communicate planned commercial strategies for your dedicated account portfolio to your vertical lead.
  • Take charge of specific champion roles in the team to support the team

 Your Profile:

  • At least 2 years of experience in account management.
  • Fluent in German and English.
  • Experience in affiliate marketing is desirable.
  • Strong negotiation skills to secure beneficial long-term partnerships.
  • Extremely Organised, Adaptable, and used to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Able to manage your portfolio and the relationships built within it efficiently and effectively.
  • Forward-thinking, Open mindset and ability to build long-term strategies.
  • Proficient in reading and interpreting data to extract insights for building compelling pitches and proposals

Our hiring process:

  1. TA Call: Meet one of our Talent Experts and get to know Atolls better.
  2. Technical Round: Focus on the technical aspects of the role (Through a Live Case), and meet your potential manager.
  3. Final Round: Meet other Atollians 🏝️
    It varies from 1 to 3 interviews

*Some processes might slightly change according to needs

Ready to apply?

Be part of a destination where your work helps millions of people make better decisions every day. One focused application is all we need. If you truly fit more than one role, you're welcome to apply to up to three. This helps us match you with the right opportunity faster.

We review every application with equal care and will reach out if your profile aligns. Apply now with your CV in English.
*Portfolios, writing samples, or certifications may be requested based on the role.
#LI-CT1

At Atolls, we want to ensure that all employees can thrive in an inclusive environment. Our employment opportunities are open to every gender, race, religion, age, sexual orientation, ability, place of origin, or socioeconomic status. We remain committed to a culture of diversity, equity and belonging, where all employees are welcomed, respected, connected, and engaged. 

#LI-Hybrid

data.title: Sales Team Lead
data.description:
Join us at Ventura TRAVEL – a group of specialized travel brands that unleash the adventurer in every person!

We're looking for a hands-on Sales Team Lead who is ready to turn experience into impact. This role is for someone who loves coaching people, fine-tuning processes, and pushing performance without losing the human touch. You'll lead by example, shape how we sell across our brands, and make sure every traveler gets guided to the trip that truly fits them. At Ventura TRAVEL, we offer authentic, interactive, and innovative travel experiences. We truly want our travelers to soak in the enriching culture and stunning beauty of the country while engaging in fun group activities with the locals. Come join us and be a part of something truly special!

Ventura TRAVEL was ranked #14 in the list of Germany's Best Employers 2024 by ZEIT (a leading national newspaper) and Kununu (Germany's top employer review platform), out of thousands of rated companies.
Read more here (in German).

On a daily basis, you will 

  • manage, motivate, and develop a dedicated team of 10 Sales Specialists.
  • coach and elevate your team and other customer-facing colleagues within Ventura TRAVEL.
  • closely monitor Sales Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and hold the team accountable to ambitious targets.
  • use AI tools to save time and improve how you work.
  • bring a critical, improvement-oriented mindset by proactively analyzing existing Sales procedures, suggesting, and implementing powerful enhancements.
  • share ideas and insights with the rest of the team.
  • stay informed about our destinations so you can answer questions confidently.
  • step in to support your team hands-on and lead by example.

The basics you bring along 

  • You have at least 5 years of sales experience.and at least 2 years of management experience.
  • You thrive on developing people, motivating teams and driving team performance.
  • You monitor KPIs closely and know how to hold a team accountable while keeping morale high.
  • You use digital tools to work smarter, not harder – and are open to new ones.
  • You're a team player and communicate clearly and respectfully.
  • You speak and write English fluently.
  • You are available to work in CET (Central European Time).
  • You stay calm and focused, even on busy days.

You can impress us even more with

  • Experience in the travel industry.
  • Familiarity with digital tools like CRMs or booking platforms.
  • German and/or French to support our wider brand operations and monitor Sales quality.

What we promise you

  • Freedom to be creative in achieving results.
  • International & friendly working environment.
  • Quarterly Social Days and Team Events.
  • Work out of other offices in the Ventura network around the world.
  • Opportunity to constantly learn and grow.
  • We care about the well-being of your employees (regular O3, satisfaction surveys etc.)
  • Yearly 2-week offsite.
  • Participation in the overall company's profits.
  • Visit our Career Page to get more insights into our office life.

Confidentiality & Diversity 

Applications at Ventura TRAVEL are treated with strict confidentiality. We use a professional HR-Software that only grants access to your applications to HR, the Recruiting Manager, and the interviewers. 

It is our commitment that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion.

data.title: Inside Sales Representative – Wolt for Work (m/f/x)
data.description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we're building the delivery of (almost) everything and you'll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn't always easy, but it's definitely exciting. Here you'll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You'll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you're a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

Inside Sales Representative – Wolt for Work (m/f/x)

Looking to kick off your sales career in one of Europe's fastest-growing tech companies? Wolt for Work is offering an exciting opportunity for ambitious early-career talent to join our growing B2B sales team in Berlin.

This role is ideal for recent graduates or professionals at the beginning of their sales career who want to learn the foundations of B2B sales in a high-growth, international environment. As an Inside Sales Representative, you'll focus on outbound prospecting, building pipeline, and setting up qualified meetings with potential Wolt for Work customers—supported by structured onboarding, hands-on coaching, and clear development paths.

About Wolt for Work

Wolt for Work is Wolt's B2B offering, bringing the same great Wolt experience to companies and their employees. Through Wolt's delivery platform, businesses can support employee meals, office events, and hybrid work—helping teams stay connected and productive.

What you'll be doing

Prospecting & outbound sales

  • Be the first point of contact for prospective German-speaking business customers, primarily via outbound cold calls.
  • Identify and engage decision-makers such as Office Managers, HR, People & Culture, and senior Leaders.
  • Spark meaningful conversations and clearly communicate the Wolt for Work value proposition.

Pipeline building

  • Book qualified introductory meetings for Sales Managers and contribute to a strong B2B sales pipeline.
  • Qualify leads based on company size, needs, and use cases.
  • Maintain accurate and up-to-date information in CRM tools.

Learning & development

  • Take part in structured onboarding covering sales fundamentals, outreach techniques, objection handling, and product knowledge.
  • Learn by doing with ongoing coaching, feedback, and performance reviews.

Team & performance ownership

  • Work closely with an international, Berlin-based sales team.
  • Track your activity and performance against clear goals and KPIs.
  • Take ownership of your impact and celebrate wins as a team.

Our humble expectations

  • Fluent in German and English (written and spoken).
  • Interest in B2B sales, business development, or customer-facing roles; prior sales or cold-calling experience is a plus, but not required.
  • Comfortable speaking on the phone and motivated by clear targets.
  • Curious, coachable, and eager to learn in a fast-paced scale-up environment.
  • Based in Berlin or willing to relocate; this is an office-first role.

Why join Wolt for Work

  • A strong entry point into B2B sales with clear career progression opportunities.
  • Structured onboarding and continuous coaching from experienced sales professionals.
  • International, ambitious, and supportive team culture.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We're committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That's why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

data.title: Enterprise Sales Manager, Wolt for Work
data.description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we're building the delivery of (almost) everything and you'll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn't always easy, but it's definitely exciting. Here you'll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You'll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you're a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

About the team

Wolt for Work is a rapidly-growing B2B business at Wolt, and we have ambitious plans to massively accelerate this growth. Our mission is simple: we want to bring the same great user experience that Wolt is known for to business users around the world. Through Wolt's established delivery network and vast number of restaurant and retail partners, Wolt for Work enables businesses to boost their employees' happiness no matter where they are working, promote camaraderie in teams, and save time and effort running office events. We are already live in 16 of Wolt's 23 countries, with no plans to slow down.

What you'll be doing

  • Full end-to-end responsibility over the sales acquisition funnel, from A-Z within the enterprise market.
  • Own the full sales cycle for inbound and outbound opportunities, including prospecting, negotiation, and closing partnership agreements across enterprise and SMB customers.
  • Acting as problem-solver for prospects' needs and working with internal stakeholders to formulate solutions for them.
  • Working closely with Account Managers to ensure consistent and optimal outcomes for the business and for clients.
  • Working with our Marketing team to develop partnerships, attend events and create an acquisition funnel.

Our humble expectations

  • Experience in sales, account management, business development and/or partnerships in B2B enterprise fields. Startup or Scaleup experience is a plus.
  • Ambition - lots of it - and strong inner motivation paired with a positive mindset (it's the key to hitting targets)
  • Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to adapt communication to suit the audience.
  • Structured and analytical problem-solver with a drive for taking action when necessary
  • Natural tendency for ownership with a get-stuff-done, entrepreneurial attitude
  • Organized and structured way of working, including working with CRMs.
  • Tenacity and creativity to approach and solve clients' problems.
  • True culture champion who rolls-up-his/her sleeves, exemplifies teamwork, and drives decision-making with data. We also value humbleness and politeness at all times!
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills in German and English.

Nice To Haves

  • High growth, startup, or scaleup experience
  • Experience with marketplace businesses
  • Experience in marketing, operations, logistics, or customer success
  • Proficiency in one or more analytics & visualization tools (e.g. Excel, G Suite, Looker)

Next steps

If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an extremely ambitious team, then and get the conversation going!

We're committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

data.title: Senior Full Stack Developer (3+ Years)
data.description:
About us

We are Paxly, a B2B SaaS startup based in Leipzig. We connect packaging buyers with suppliers through our smart procurement platform – think of it as the missing link between “I need 1,000,000 cardboard boxes” and “here’s the best supplier for your specs.”

We have hit product-market fit, have paying customers, and now we our looking to scale. Not just the product, also the engineering team.

Who is behind this

Three founders. Torsten is our packaging industry expert – he knows the domain inside out. Klaus and Hendrik are seasoned entrepreneurs with a track record of building and scaling companies. We have done this before. This time, we are doing it in packaging.

Tasks

The honest situation

Right now, our tech team is tiny: one senior developer and our CTO. We are not a 50-person engineering org with layers of process. We are two people who ship things.

That is where you come in.

What you will do

You will be the third engineer – but really, the first hire that shapes how we grow. You will work across our main platform (Java/Angular) and touch our AI-powered document processing system (Python). You will help us build CI/CD pipelines, improve test coverage, and strengthen our engineering foundations.

This is not a “implement tickets from Jira” role. You ‘ll have opinions. You’ll push back. You’ll help us decide what to build, not just how.

The tech

  • Back-end: Java 17, Dropwizard, PostgreSQL
  • Front-end: Angular 16+
  • Infrastructure: AWS (EC2, ECS, RDS, S3), Docker, Redis
  • Side quest: Python/FastAPI

You don’t need all of it. Java + Angular is the core. The rest you can learn.

Requirements

What we are looking for

  • 3+ years of professional development experience
  • Strong in Java or a similar back-end language
  • Comfortable with Angular (or willing to get comfortable fast)
  • You’ve worked with relational databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL)
  • You’ve touched CI/CD, Docker, or cloud infrastructure
  • You take ownership – “not my code” isn’t in your vocabulary
  • Bilingual: English (professional), German (B2+)

Strong plus

  • You know when to use AI coding tools – and when to write it yourself
  • Experience with modern AI approaches (LLMs, prompt engineering, AI-assisted workflows)
  • Python experience
  • AWS knowledge
  • You’ve worked in a small team or startup before

Benefits

What we offer

Hybrid Work

Leipzig preferred, remote acceptable. Workation in EU possible.

Flexible Working Hours

Ownership, not time clocks. You organize yourself.

Real Impact

Your code runs in production, you decision matters.

Salary

55.000 - 75.000€ depending on your experience.

Team-Events

We meet 3-4 times a year for team events, because even the best remote culture can't replace a good beer.

Startup with Substance

Solid product, paying customers, zero bullshit.

Our culture

We win and lose as a team. (But mostly we win ;-))

No bullshit. No politics. No endless meetings about meetings. We say what we think, we fix what’s broken, we ship what matters.

We believe in a realistic workweek and work-life balance. We’re not impressed by rockstar culture or overtime heroes. But when the roof is on fire, we expect everyone to grab a bucket. That’s the deal.

If you’re looking for a place to grow inside a startup – to learn fast, take on responsibility early, and build something real – this is it.

Not for you if

  • You need detailed specs before writing a line of code
  • You prefer large teams with clear role boundaries
  • You want a 9-to-5 with zero exceptions, ever

Our Proccess

  • Speed Dating (15 min) – Quick mutual vibe check.
  • In-Depth Interview – With HR and your future manager.
  • Meet the Team (optional) – Because chemistry matters.
  • Decision & Start – Good fit? Let's go.

Sounds interesting?
Send us your CV and a few sentences about why Paxly caught your attention. No formal cover letter needed.

data.title: Junior IOT & Embedded linux Developer (m/w/d) IoT Startup
data.description:
Do you have a passion for electronics and IoT? Do you thrive in a fast-moving environment and want to help shape the future of autonomous retail?

We’re looking for a hands-on engineer to join us on-site, building and maintaining the embedded Linux agents that power our smart kiosks. You’ll work at the heart of our technology, integrating payment terminals and other peripherals to bring seamless, reliable performance to life. If you’re excited about turning cutting-edge ideas into robust, real-world solutions, we’d love to hear from you!

Tasks

  • Develop and maintain Python edge agents on embedded Linux devices (ARM/Raspberry Pi class) with focus on reliability, telemetry, and updates
  • Integrate payment terminals (e.g. MDB/ZVT) and ensure robust transaction flows, including error recovery
  • Perform signal-level debugging using oscilloscopes and logic analyzers
  • Harden Linux images (systemd services, logging, boot behavior) with reproducible setups (e.g. Ansible)
  • Contribute to testability and documentation through hardware-in-the-loop tests, protocol traces, and troubleshooting guides

Requirements

  • Ausbildung als Fachinformatiker, Mathematisch-technischer Softwareentwickler or studies in a information technology field
  • Strong ability for abstract and analytical thinking – more important than formal education
  • Fluent in english, german is a plus
  • Nice to have: Experience with MQTT, DOCKER, D‑Bus/NetworkManager, oscilloscope/logic analyzer or Payment terminals/vending protocols

Benefits

  • A key role in a fast-growing, highly innovative start-up
  • An agile, international team with colleagues from around the globe
  • Open work culture with flat hierarchies and quick decision-making
  • Dog-friendly office in a central location with great food, shopping, and excellent public transport connections
  • Modern tech stack featuring the latest IoT hardware and software
  • Plenty of creative freedom for your ideas, projects, and personal growth
  • Free EGYM Wellpass membership

We are a B2B IoT tech startup focused on a smart kiosk (intelligent fridge) that independently recognizes, tracks, manages, and sells products.

Our mission is to use our technology to provide people with simple and fast access to healthy food and other everyday essentials — anytime and anywhere.

Our vision: We are developing the future of "Automated Autonomous Retail" and plan to install Livello stations in every large company and in all places where people work, travel, and spend their time.

Our customers include companies such as grocery retailers/producers, hotels, restaurants, clinics, universities, delivery services, and catering providers in communal food services.

data.title: Praktikum - Marketing - Social Media & Content - (m/w/d)
data.description:
Was machen wir bei Sunpeak Capital?

Rund 74 % aller CO₂-Emissionen in Deutschland entstehen im Zusammenhang mit der Energieproduktion - das sind über 543 Millionen Tonnen pro Jahr.

Um die europäischen Klimaziele zu erreichen, müssen wir dieses Problem dringend und entschlossen angehen und genau hier setzen wir bei Sunpeak Capital an.

Wir machen den Ausbau erneuerbarer Energien investierbar und verwandeln Photovoltaik, Batteriespeicher und Ladeinfrastruktur in renditestarke, steueroptimierte Investments. Unser Ansatz verbindet Klimaschutz mit finanzieller Intelligenz: Ein echtes Win-Win für Umwelt und Investoren.

Mit unserer Kombination aus spezialisierten Beratungsprozessen, innovativen Investmentstrukturen und einem breitem Netzwerk aus Projektentwicklern ermöglichen wir privaten und unternehmerischen Investoren, den Energiewandel aktiv mitzugestalten - profitabel und nachhaltig.

Wir skalieren unser Modell konsequent innerhalb Deutschlands - dort, wo die Energiewende entschieden wird. Werde Teil unseres Teams und trage dazu bei, dass Kapitalströme dorthin fließen, wo sie größten Klimanutzen und echte Rendite erzeugen.

Aufgaben

  • Mitarbeit bei der Entwicklung einer kanalübergreifenden Content-Strategie sowie beim Aufbau und der Pflege eines strukturierten Redaktionsplans für Instagram, LinkedIn und Facebook
  • Konzeption und Erstellung von hochwertigem Content für unsere gesamte Online-Kommunikation - Social Media, Website, Newsletter, CRM-Strecken und Videoformate
  • Eigenständige Pflege und Weiterentwicklung unseres Ratgeber-Blogs, von Themenrecherche bis zur SEO-Optimierung
  • Unterstützung beim Aufbau, Monitoring und der Optimierung von Paid-Marketing-Kampagnen auf Meta, LinkedIn & Co.
  • Analyse relevanter KPIs zur Identifikation von Performance-Potenzialen und Ableitung datenbasierter Optimierungen

Qualifikation

  • Studium in Marketing, Kommunikation, BWL oder einem vergleichbaren Studiengang
  • Leidenschaft für Marketing sowie ausgeprägte kommunikative Fähigkeiten, eine proaktive Hands-on Mentalität und Freude daran, Verantwortung zu übernehmen
  • Gespür für Design und sicherer Umgang mit Canva zur Erstellung von Social-Media- und Website-Assets
  • Grundkenntnisse im Videoschnitt (z. B. für kurze Erklärvideos oder Social-Media-Formate)
  • Sehr starke Deutschkenntnisse sowie die Fähigkeit, komplexe Themen klar, strukturiert und zielgruppengerecht aufzubereiten
  • Nice to have: Erste Berührungspunkte mit erneuerbaren Energien, Photovoltaik, Batteriespeichern, Ladeinfrastruktur oder Energiemärkten
  • Die Bereitschaft, regelmäßig in unserem Berliner Büro zu arbeiten
  • Von Vorteil sind nachgewiesene Erfahrung in der Erstellung von Konzepten, Marketing-Content und dem Management von Performance-Marketing Kampagnen

Benefits

  • Attraktive Vergütung: Hervorragende Leistung wird bei uns belohnt - mit einem monatlichen Gehalt von 3.000 € sowie einer Urban Sports Club Mitgliedschaft
  • Modernes Office in Berlin: Genieße Kaffee in Barista-Qualität, ein eigenes Gym sowie einen Rooftop-Pool für die perfekte Work-Life-Balance
  • Ideale Vorbereitung für deine eigene Gründung: Lerne hautnah, wie man ein Startup aufbaut, skaliert und operative sowie strategische Entscheidungen trifft
  • Regelmäßige Team-Events & Lunches: Gemeinsame Aktivitäten stärken das Miteinander und machen die Zeit bei uns noch besser
  • Perspektive auf Übernahme: Wenn es für beide Seiten passt, bieten wir dir die Möglichkeit, langfristig Teil unseres Teams zu werden.

Sunpeak Capital entstand aus der gemeinsamen Vision von Konstantin und Jan. Vor der Gründung waren sie die ersten beiden Mitarbeiter des Fintech-Scale-ups Cloover, welches PV-Anlagen finanziert. Für dieses bauten sie den deutschen Markt auf und skalierten und das Partnernetzwerk auf über 200 Installationsbetriebe. In dieser Zeit erkannten sie, welches Potenzial entsteht, wenn man Kapital gezielt in nachhaltige Energieprojekte lenkt.

Anfang 2025 gründeten sie dann Sunpeak Capital - vollständig gebootstrapped und bereits nach zwei Monaten profitabel. Ihr Antrieb: die Mechanismen des Kapitalmarkts nutzen, um den Ausbau erneuerbarer Energien zu beschleunigen und Investoren echte Rendite mit echtem Impact zu ermöglichen.

Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!

data.title: Blockchain Engineer
data.description:
Are you excited by the opportunity to become a part of a badass team leading the AI-first data revolution?

Do you thrive on solving hard problems (individually and collectively), yet humble and hungry to learn and grow within a team on your path to greatness?

Do you desire to become a part of a close-knit pack led by SV startup veterans who can accelerate your growth 10X (compared to the corporate trajectory/culture)?

If you’ve answered with 3 resounding "yes", then we want to meet you!

CEF is building a decentralised AI and data infrastructure platform, with Cere Network forming the core Web3 data and blockchain backbone of the CEF ecosystem.

We are looking for an experienced engineer who is motivated by solving hard technical problems and contributing to long-term infrastructure, rather than short-term hype.

We are seeking a Lead Blockchain Engineer with strong experience in designing, developing, and operating Layer 1 (L1) blockchain systems. In this role, you will work on the Cere protocol, which underpins CEF’s decentralised data and compute architecture. You will be responsible for evolving the core protocol, maintaining production networks, and improving the surrounding ecosystem tooling, as part of our work on autonomous and sovereign data computing.

Tasks

  • Architect Core Protocol: Continuously upgrade the Cere Protocol L1 blockchain using Rust and Substrate, creating custom pallets to power Decentralized Data Clusters (DDC).
  • Engineer Trust: Implement Proof-of-Compute (Data activity capture) to automate verification and payments for every computation on-chain.
  • Design Privacy Infrastructure: Develop Zero-Knowledge primitives and the EDEK system to for client-side data sovereignty.
  • Manage Governance: Maintain and upgrade the OpenGov framework powering on-chain democracy.
  • Ensure Security: execute rigorous internal audits of smart contracts and protocol upgrades.

Requirements

General

  • Rust: 7+ years of engineering experience with deep expertise in Rust and the Substrate framework.
  • Crypto Depth: Strong grasp of applied cryptography, specifically hashing, signatures, and ZK proofs.
  • Distributed Systems: Proven experience in architecting scalable distributed systems and consensus algorithms.
  • Governance Knowledge: Technical familiarity with on-chain governance models (e.g., Polkadot/OpenGov).

Blockchain Operations

  • Hands-on experience in developing or modifying blockchain protocols / core components and utilities, as well as working closely with ecosystem/communities participants to improve the above.
  • Practical experience with deployment of DDC nodes (testnet and mainnet)
  • Experience in node setup, configuration, and maintenance, including: configuration management, version upgrades, key management, working with logs and metrics, monitoring systems. Strong experience with: Linux Docker / Docker Compose (Kubernetes is a plus)

Nice to have

  • Education: BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent high-impact Web3 experience.
  • Experience with Substrate (FRAME, runtime development, or pallet design) is a strong plus.

Benefits

  • Real Equity & Fair Pay: We believe in true partnership. You will get a competitive salary and meaningful equity so your personal upside is tied directly to the company's success.
  • Ownership, Not Just Tasks: You won't be lost in a big machine here. You will take full ownership of your projects and help define the future of our Web3 stack.
  • Direct Access to Leadership: You are part of the core conversation. You will work side by side with the CEO and founders every day to solve hard problems and set the strategy.
  • Inventing the Future: We are building the infrastructure for autonomous AI agents that doesn't exist yet. This is the place for you if you want to do original work instead of maintaining legacy systems.
  • Builders Decide: We hate red tape as much as you do. We stay lean and let the people building the product make the decisions that drive the roadmap.
  • Remote with Connection: We are remote first but value real face time. We meet monthly in SF and Europe to build momentum together because we know results matter more than counting hours.

Our Hiring Process

We move fast, stay transparent, and focus on real collaboration. Here’s what the process looks like:

  1. Intro Call – A quick chat to align on expectations, interests, and team fit.
  2. Technical Deep Dive – A focused conversation with our Engineering Manager to explore your technical thinking and past work.
  3. CEO Interview – A strategic discussion around vision, mindset, and long-term alignment.
  4. Reference Collection – We’ll speak with a few people you’ve worked closely with.
  5. Paid Trial (~5 Days) – A short, real-world engagement so we can see how we work together — happening in parallel with offer and terms discussion.

Please note:

  • As a startup, you can expect a fast-paced environment where extreme ownership is required.
  • If you are seeking a traditional corporate 9-to-5 role, this may not be the right fit.

"It's not 10,000 hours, it's 10,000 iterations”; “Work like a lion” - Naval Ravikant

data.title: Intern/Working Student - Business Automation (AI & Ops)
data.description:
TL;DR

Automate the boring stuff. Kill stupid work. Join experienced entrepreneurs (scaled to millions of users, $100m+ exits). Bridge the gap between complex tax processes and modern AI. You won't just analyze problems; you will fix them immediately using No-Code tools (Make, n8n, Airtable) and Python/JS snippet. Learn from the founders, own your projects, and enable us to scale rapidly & efficiently.

The opportunity

How taxation, accounting, and payroll work today is a pain for everyone. Still, every business must do it continuously. It is the backbone that our economy runs on. Enabled through AI, we are turning this often-painful process into a radically simple experience for our customers, so they can focus on what matters to them: growing their business.

About us

We are a team of experienced entrepreneurs who have scaled businesses to 10s of millions of users, 10s of millions in revenue, multiple countries, and 9-digit exits - and we are just getting started. We are backed with € 3 million in equity, even though we haven’t actively raised funding yet – yes, investors are chasing us.

Tasks

The role

As our Intern/Working Student - Business Automation (AI & Ops), you will operate at the intersection of Engineering and Operations. You will sit directly with the engineering team and our tax experts to decompose complex workflows into modular, automated solutions.

You are not here to write long reports on what could be done. You are here to build the solution and radically kill stupid work and free your colleagues of it. You will design, build, and maintain the automated workflows that allow us to deliver a world-class professional service without drowning in manual work. You will be the builder of our internal scalability.

What you’ll own

  • Implement RPA & Experiment with AI Agents: You will build robust Robotic Process Automations (RPA) for structured tasks using Make and n8n, while leveraging Agentic Process Automation (APA) where standard bots fail.
  • "Kill Stupid Work": You actively hunt for repetitive, manual tasks with our tax experts and ruthlessly automate them to free up time for high-value work - your colleagues will love you.
  • Bot Failure & Optimization: Automations break. You are the first line of defense, ensuring our "digital workforce" is reliable, scalable, and constantly improving - optimizing for error handling and scalability as we grow.

Our automation context (Greenfield)

  • Tools over rules: We prefer pragmatic solutions. If it solves the problem fast and reliably, use it.
  • Your influence: You will help us evaluate and prototype new tools.
  • Budget: Access to the best tooling to make you and the team fast.

Requirements

What you’ll bring

  • Background: Pursuing a degree in Business Informatics, Business Administration, Computer Science, or a related field - OR standout real-world experience.
  • No-Code Mastery: Experience with automation platforms like Make, n8n, or Zapier. You understand webhooks, APIs, and logic flow.
  • Analytical & Massive Bias for Action: You have meticulous attention to detail. When you see a broken process, you feel a personal urge to fix it immediately + you act on it.
  • Business x Tech Translator: You can speak the language of business (efficiency, reliability) and translate it into the language of tech (logic loops, database structures).
  • Problem Solving: Impressive solution orientation. You see a broken process as a personal challenge to fix immediately.
  • Communication: Fluency in German (C1/native) and English is a MUST (you will be automating workflows involving complex German tax documentation).
  • Presence: Availability to work onsite in our Munich office.

Nice to have

  • Coding Basics: You know enough JavaScript or Python to write custom script blocks in Make/n8n when the standard modules aren't enough.
  • Data Literacy: Familiarity with SQL or setting up dashboards in tools like Airtable or HubSpot.
  • Startup/Agency Experience: You have worked in a fast-paced environment where "done is better than perfect".

Benefits

What you’ll get

  • Learn from experienced founders: Work directly alongside a diverse team of tech entrepreneurs, tax experts, and AI specialists.
  • Strong growth potential: You will help build the core processes that define the future of tax advisory.
  • Modern setup: No legacy issues or outdated systems. We rely on state-of-the-art tools, clear structures, and data-driven decision-making.
  • Office Culture: Based in our Munich office, you will work closely with the team, gaining exposure to strategy and operational decisions.

The process (fast, but meaningful)

  1. Jump on an intro call with a founder or recruiter.
  2. Get to know a founder or engineer, virtually or in person (up to you).
  3. Meet our whole founding team during a final interview (in-person, ~3h, incl. working session).

data.title: Customer Experience Manager (all genders)
data.description:
Your mission

Empower our customers to succeed with our cutting-edge data and software solutions in the travel industry. You’ll be a trusted point of contact helping them extract value from our tools, many of which are embedded in customer systems and increasingly powered by automation and AI.

  • Consult & Technical Support:
    Support customers during onboarding, technical certifications, integrations, and ongoing implementations. Learn to work with APIs, data structures, and system interactions, while creating and maintaining documentation and learning resources that help customers work independently. Collaborate closely with internal technical teams to ensure smooth go-lives.
  • AI-Enhanced Enablement:
    Use analytics and AI-driven insights to understand customer usage patterns, anticipate challenges, and help deliver recommendations that improve adoption and performance.
  • Collaboration & Advocacy:
    Work cross-functionally with Product, Tech, and Sales teams to bring customer feedback and technical requirements into product improvements and measurable success outcomes.
  • Data-Driven Retention:
    Help monitor usage and integration health, identify adoption risks, and support the creation of action plans to drive customer satisfaction, retention, and growth.

Your profile

You bring a strong interest in technical topics and customer collaboration, and you’re motivated to deepen your skills and grow with us—regardless of whether you are at the beginning of your career or already bring first professional experience.

  • Languages: Fluent German (required) and strong English skills to collaborate effectively with international colleagues and customers.
  • Technical Foundations: Initial understanding of APIs, XML/JSON, and common tools like Excel or CRM systems (HubSpot a plus), and a willingness to continuously expand your technical know‑how.
  • Analytical Curiosity: Enjoy working with data, dashboards, and AI‑supported insights to spot patterns, challenges, and opportunities.
  • Working Style: Proactive, structured, and customer‑focused, with the ability to pick up technical concepts quickly and communicate them clearly to diverse stakeholders.

Why us?

  • Complete trust in your abilities and plenty of space for creative and self-directed work.
  • A permanent contract in a stable, dynamic, and future-oriented company, as well as flexible working hours and a hybrid office/remote work model.
  • Up to 4 weeks of "Work from Anywhere" per year.
  • Benefits like a BVG Germany Ticket, an Urban Sports Club membership and meal subsidies
  • Tourism perks like the DRV Card and other discounts.

Inclusivity at GIATA

At GIATA, we are committed to creating an inclusive environment where all employees feel valued, respected, and supported. We strive to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our communities. We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications regardless of race, ethnicity, religion, gender, origin, disability, marital status, citizenship, or gender identity. If you have a disability or specific needs that require accommodation, please let us know.

data.title: Software Project Manager / Scrum Master (m/w/d)
data.description:
Du hast ein Händchen für effiziente Projektplanung, brennst für moderne Softwarelösungen und behältst als Scrum Master auch in komplexen Phasen stets den Überblick und den Teamspirit im Fokus?

Dann bist Du bei uns richtig!

Wer sind wir?

Die BWSolution GmbH ist ein erfolgreiches Unternehmen mit zentralem Sitz direkt an der Binnenalster in Hamburg (zwischen Jungfernstieg und Hauptbahnhof). Unser Hauptprodukt ist die Software „CarLiner“. Damit unterstützen wir klassische Autohäuser und andere Fahrzeughändler im Bereich der Digitalisierung und der Vertriebsprozesse. Unser Team hat „CarLiner“ in den letzten 20 Jahren zu einer führenden Lösung in diesem Marktsegment entwickelt.

Bei uns triffst du auf kurze Entscheidungswege, ein motiviertes Team und echte Leidenschaft für Code und Cars.

Um unsere Entwicklungsteams optimal zu steuern und unsere Produktvision auf die Straße zu bringen, suchen wir Dich als organisatorisches Rückgrat unseres Software-Development-Bereiches.

Aufgaben

Du bist das Bindeglied zwischen unserem fachlichen Produktmanagement, dem Tech-Lead/CTO und den Entwicklerteams. Du sorgst dafür, dass wir „in Time“ und „in Quality“ liefern.

  • Agile Prozesssteuerung: Du organisierst und moderierst die Scrum-Events (Daily Stand-ups, Refinements, Planning, Reviews und Retrospektiven) und sorgst für einen reibungslosen Ablauf.
  • Projektmanagement & Fokus: Du behältst den Überblick über den Projektplan, identifizierst kritische Pfade (Critical Path) frühzeitig und steuerst proaktiv gegen Blockaden.
  • Ticket- & Backlog-Management: In Jira übersetzt du (zusammen mit Produktmanagement und Tech-Lead) fachliche Anforderungen in entwicklungsreife Tickets. Du achtest darauf, dass Akzeptanzkriterien klar sind und die Dokumentation in Confluence aktuell bleibt.
  • Release-Begleitung: Du verfolgst den Status der Features nicht nur auf dem Board, sondern verstehst auch den Zusammenhang zum Code-Status (via Bitbucket-Verknüpfung), um Release-Termine sicherzustellen.
  • Stakeholder-Kommunikation: Du bist Ansprechpartner für den Status Quo der Entwicklung und sorgst für Transparenz über Fortschritte und Herausforderungen im Team.
  • Qualität & Flow: Du schützt das Team vor ungeplanten Störungen

Qualifikation

  • Erfahrung: Du hast Berufserfahrung im IT-Projektmanagement oder als Scrum Master in der Softwareentwicklung.
  • Atlassian-Profi: Du beherrschst Jira und Confluence sicher. Du weißt, wie man Backlogs sauber pflegt, Workflows konfiguriert und effiziente Dokumentationen erstellt.
  • Methodenkompetenz: Du fühlst dich in der agilen Welt (Scrum/Kanban) zu Hause, verstehst aber auch, wie man Deadlines und Meilensteine in einem klassischen Projektkontext managt.
  • Technisches Verständnis: Du musst nicht selbst programmieren, aber du verstehst den Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) und sprichst die Sprache der Entwickler.
  • Kommunikationsstärke: Du moderierst souverän zwischen technischen und fachlichen Ansprechpartnern und hast ein Gespür für Teamdynamik.
  • Sprache: Verhandlungssichere Deutschkenntnisse und gutes Englisch.

Benefits

  • Eine vielseitige, selbstständige und verantwortungsvolle Tätigkeit in einem wachsenden Unternehmen
  • Einbindung in alle Phasen der Softwareprojekte von der Planung bis zum Betrieb
  • Scrum mit Zwei- bzw. Drei-Wochen-Sprints, schnelle und sichtbare Erfolge im Prozess sowie flache Hierarchien
  • Wöchentliche „Knowledge Sharing Sessions“ sowie vielfältige Entwicklungs- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
  • Ein unbefristeter Arbeitsvertrag ist die Basis
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten mit Vertrauensarbeitszeit
  • Arbeit im Homeoffice wird bei uns gelebt und ist nach Absprache möglich
  • Entwicklungsumgebung und Endgeräte (wahlweise MacBook Pro oder Windows-Notebook)
  • Teamorientierte Arbeitsatmosphäre und tolle Kollegen
  • Kostenlose Getränke, Obstkorb sowie Team-Events (z.B. unsere After-Work-Partys mit Alsterblick)
  • HVV-Ticket oder Firmenfahrrad sind möglich
  • Sportprogramm (Kooperation mit einem Fitnessstudio)
  • Zentrale Lage an der Alster mit sehr guter Verkehrsanbindung: fußläufig zum Hauptbahnhof und zum Jungfernstieg

Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt?

Dann sende uns bitte Deine vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen mit Angabe Deiner Gehaltsvorstellung und des möglichen Eintrittstermins.

BWSolution GmbH | Ballindamm 13 | 20095 Hamburg | 040 600 8 999 0

data.title: E-Commerce Manager (w/m/d)
data.description:
Unser Daily Business: Kleine Wunder wahr werden lassen! Mit den Health Brands BabyFORTE, MascuPRO und PuriaFAM begleiten wir unsere treue Community mit einzigartiger Nahrungsergänzung rund um die Schwangerschaft sowie für typische Gesundheitsthemen von Männern und Frauen. Willst auch Du Wunder wahr werden lassen? Dann suchen wir Dich!

Aufgaben

Deine Rolle: Das ist keine klassische Management-Position. Du arbeitest hands-on in den Systemen – im Shop, in Tools, an Schnittstellen und auf Marktplätzen. Du identifizierst Probleme und Potenziale, entwickelst konkrete Lösungsansätze, bringst diese ins Team ein, priorisierst gemeinsam und setzt beschlossene Maßnahmen eigenständig um. Dabei zählen Neugier, Eigeninitiative und Lernbereitschaft mehr als starre Prozesse oder „das haben wir schon immer so gemacht“.

Deine Aufgaben:

Shop Ownership & Performance-Optimierung

  • Operative und strategische Verantwortung für unseren Shopify-Shop
  • Datengetriebene Optimierung von CVR, AOV, Funnels und Customer Journey – von Analyse bis zur eigenständigen Umsetzung
  • Entwicklung und Priorisierung konkreter Optimierungsmaßnahmen (Hypothesen, Aufwand, Impact) auf Basis von Daten und Nutzerverhalten
  • Konzeption, Umsetzung und Testing von Landingpages, Launch-Funnels sowie A/B-Experimenten
  • Migration weiterer Shops von WooCommerce zu Shopify
  • Verantwortung für zentrale KPIs wie CTR, CVR, AOV, CAC und CLV

Marketplace-Operations

  • Maßgebliche Unterstützung beim Listing-Management, Performance-Optimierung und den Marketplace-Operations
  • Tool-Recherche und Implementierung (z. B. Helium 10, Jungle Scout, AMZScout, Keepa)
  • Unterstützung bei Produkt- und Markt-Recherche, Keyword-Optimierung, Listing-Analyse, PPC, Trends und Performance-Tracking
  • Optimierung von Listings, SEO-relevantem Content und A+ Content

Tools, Schnittstellen & Prozesse

  • Überblick über unsere Systemlandschaft (Shop, Marktplätze, ERP/WaWi, CRM, FiBu, Analytics, Marketing)
  • Auswahl, Installation und Konfiguration von Tools & Apps
  • Sicherstellung funktionierender Datenflüsse zwischen Systemen
  • Eigenständige Analyse und Behebung technischer Probleme, punktuell mit externen Expert:innen
  • Weiterentwicklung und Dokumentation systemnaher Prozesse und Workflows

Analyse & Enablement

  • Monitoring und Reporting zentraler E-Commerce-KPIs mit GA4, Shopify Analytics und weiteren Tools
  • Interpretation der Performance Reports mit Ableitung klarer Insights und Maßnahmen
  • Aufbereitung von Entscheidungsvorlagen für Management und Marketing

Wichtig zum Schluss

Dieser Job passt nicht zu Dir, wenn Du nur koordinieren willst, statt selbst umzusetzen, auf perfekte Briefings wartest oder lieber bestehende Best Practices verwaltest, als Neues zu lernen.

Der Job bei BabyFORTE passt sehr gut zu Dir, wenn Du Probleme selbst lösen willst, gerne Verantwortung übernimmst und Lust hast, E-Commerce aktiv weiterzuentwickeln.

Qualifikation

Dein Profil

  • Mind. 3 Jahre relevante E-Commerce-Erfahrung (D2C/B2C & Marktplätze) mit messbaren Erfolgen in UX-Optimierung und Conversion Growth sowie fundiertem Shopify-Know-how
  • Starkes Ownership- und Hands-on-Mindset: Du analysierst, konzipierst und setzt eigenständig um
  • Gutes technisches Verständnis für Tools, Schnittstellen und Datenflüsse
  • Erfahrung mit Amazon Seller Central / Vendor Central
  • Fundierte Analysekompetenz mit GA4 und Shopify Analytics, inkl. Conversion-Tracking, Funnel- & Attributions Logiken sowie KPI-basiertem Arbeiten in Excel/Google Sheet
  • Strukturierte, teamorientierte Arbeitsweise und souveräne Zusammenarbeit mit internen und externen Stakeholdern
  • Hohe Eigeninitiative sowie proaktive, lösungsorientierte Denkweise mit pragmatischem Vorgehen und hohem Qualitätsanspruch
  • Deutsch auf muttersprachlichem Niveau, verhandlungssicheres Englisch

Außerdem freuen wir uns, wenn Du Folgendes mitbringst:

  • Erfahrung mit TikTok Shop und Marktplätzen wie DocMorris, Shop-Apotheke, Kaufland
  • Grundkenntnisse in HTML/ CSS
  • Kenntnisse mit Loyalty-und Referral-Programmen
  • Erfahrungen im CRM und Newsletter Marketing

Benefits

Warum wir?

  • Job mit Sinn in erfolgreichen Health Brands
  • Diese Stelle ist hybrid angelegt. Remote-Arbeit ist möglich, setzt jedoch eine regelmäßige Anwesenheit in unserem Berliner Office voraus
  • Wir sind ein dynamisches, profitables und eigenfinanziertes Unternehmen mit viel Gestaltungs- und Entwicklungsraum sowie schnellen Entscheidungswegen
  • Wir denken auch an später und unterstützen Dich auf Wunsch mit einer betrieblichen Altersvorsorge
  • Flexibles Arbeitszeitmodell
  • Förderung Deiner persönlichen und fachlichen Skills durch regelmäßige Trainings und 1:1 Gespräche mit Deinem Mentor
  • Hire for attitude - train for skills! Bei uns steht Deine Persönlichkeit im Fokus - denn schließlich können wir alle immer noch etwas dazulernen

Das klingt nach Deinem nächsten Schritt? Dann freuen wir uns über Deine Bewerbung inkl. Lebenslauf, Referenzen (Portfolio, Profile, etc.), Gehaltsvorstellung und Startdatum!

Wir freuen uns auf Dich!

data.title: SAP-Entwickler (mIwId) ABAP
data.description:
Dein Herz schlägt für moderne Frontend und Backend Entwicklung!

Unser Mandant ist u.a. ein spezialisiertes Software-Entwicklungsunternehmen im Bereich SAP Vertragsmanagement. Es bietet individuelle, nachhaltige – von der SAP zertifizierte - Lösungen und setzt auf langfristige, vertrauensvolle Kundenbeziehungen. Mit fundierter technischer und fachlicher Erfahrung im Bereich SAP Vertragsmanagement unterstützt unser Mandant seine Kunden bei der Optimierung von End-2-End Prozessen. Zur Verstärkung des Teams suchen wir ab sofort einen SAP-Entwickler (mIwId) ABAP, der gemeinsam mit erfahrenen Experten an spannenden Projekten arbeitet und zur Digitalisierung unserer Kunden beiträgt. Starte jetzt deine Karriere und gestalte eine sichere digitale Zukunft.

Standort: Großraum Hamburg I Einstiegsdatum: nach persönlicher Verfügbarkeit

Aufgaben

  • Erweitere und optimiere bestehende SAP Contract Management Produkte auf der Basis zukünftiger Technologien
  • Erstelle SAP-Anwendungen in ABAP, ABAP OO, SAP Fiori, SAPUI5 (BTP, Cloud)
  • Entwickle mit unserem Mandant und deren Kunden Dashboards sowie KI-gestützte Tools zur Datenerfassung und Analyse
  • Unterstütze unsere IT-Consultants und den Service-Desk bei Workshops, Lösungsdesign und Fehleranalysen, sowie der fachlichen Kundenbetreuung
  • Führe Softwaretests durch und stelle Wartung, Performance und Dokumentation sicher
  • Betreue und unterstütze Kollegen und Studierende bei Entwicklungsprojekten, übernimm Anleitung und Wissenstransfer

Qualifikation

  • Du verfügst über sehr gute Kenntnisse in SAP ABAP, HANA und SAP-Webtechnologien (u.a. JavaScript)
  • Du bringst Berufserfahrung in der Entwicklung im Umfeld SAP Fiori/SAPUI5 (BTP, SAP Cloud Connector) und Frontend-/Backend-Entwicklung mit
  • Deine Projekterfahrung in der Entwicklung, Optimierung und Implementierung von SAP-Lösungen sind mit deiner DNA verknüpft
  • Deine ausgeprägten analytischen Fähigkeiten sowie ein hohes technisches Verständnis für komplexe Vernetzungen und Abhängigkeiten zeichnet dich aus
  • Deine Teamfähigkeit, Kommunikationsstärke und Lernbereitschaft runden dein Profil ab

Benefits

Wissenswertes:

Vielfältige persönliche und fachliche Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten

  • Möglichkeit zum mobilen Arbeiten
  • Bezuschusste betriebliche Altersvorsorge (BAV)
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten
  • 30 Urlaubstage
  • Ein offenes Ohr für deine kreativen Ideen
  • Flache Hierarchien und eine familiäre Atmosphäre
  • Übernahme Deutschland-Ticket
  • Eine sorgfältige und individuelle Einarbeitung
  • Feelgood-Atmosphäre bei Afterworks,- Sommer und Weihnachtsfeste

Was wir bieten:

Wir öffnen dir die Türen zu einem exklusiven Netzwerk von Top-Unternehmen und pflegen direkten, persönlichen Kontakt zu unseren Mandanten. Wir wissen, wer sie sind, was sie suchen – und wie wir dich optimal positionieren. In einem ersten, unverbindlichen Gespräch gleichen wir deine fachlichen Stärken und persönlichen Wünsche mit den Anforderungen der Position ab. Gemeinsam analysieren wir deinen Lebenslauf, geben dir ehrliches Feedback zur Außenwirkung und zeigen dir, wo noch Potenzial schlummert. Die gesamte Kommunikation mit dem Mandanten übernehmen wir für dich – professionell, diskret und selbstverständlich kostenfrei. data.title: Talent & Operations Coordinator (m/f/d)
data.description:
Company

We are a Berlin-based B2C fintech operating in stealth, founded by two repeat founders (YC alum, exit) with prior 10+ year careers in investment banking and strategy consulting, respectively. We recently raised investment to assemble a 30 people, exceptionally strong core team.

Our culture is built on ownership and clarity. We align with you on vision, then set KPIs and required resources together, and then trust your drive and expertise.

The Opportunity

We're scaling from 5 to 30 people over the next 12 months, and we need someone to own our talent acquisition while helping build the operational foundation that enables this growth.

This is a hands-on, versatile role for someone who thrives in the dynamic environment of an early-stage startup. Your primary focus will be recruiting: sourcing, screening, and coordinating hiring across technical, commercial, and operational roles. But you'll also be instrumental in building our people operations and jumping in wherever needed as we scale.

If you're energized by variety, love building from scratch, and want to grow alongside a fast-moving company, this role offers significant impact and development opportunity.

Tasks

What you’ll do

Talent Acquisition

  • Own full-cycle recruiting coordination across all departments (tech, marketing, sales, operations)

  • Source candidates through LinkedIn, job boards, networks, and creative outreach

  • Conduct initial screening calls to assess fit, motivation, and alignment with our culture

  • Coordinate interview processes and ensure excellent candidate experience

  • Build our employer brand and talent pipeline for future hiring needs

  • Support hiring managers with market insights and recruiting best practices

People & Operations Support

  • Coordinate onboarding for new hires (contracts, equipment, first-week experience)
  • Maintain employee records and HR documentation
  • Support office coordination and vendor management as needed
  • Help document and improve operational processes as we scale
  • Jump in on operational projects where extra hands are needed
  • Contribute to building our company culture and employee experience

Requirements

What you bring

  • 2-4 years of experience in recruiting, talent acquisition, HR, or people operations (startup experience strongly preferred)
  • Hands-on recruiting experience - you know how to source candidates, write compelling outreach, and assess fit
  • Startup mentality - comfortable with ambiguity, changing priorities, and wearing multiple hats
  • Organizational excellence - you're detail-oriented, can manage multiple processes simultaneously, and nothing falls through the cracks
  • Strong communication skills - you can engage candidates professionally and represent our company compellingly
  • Proactive and resourceful - you see what needs doing and figure out how to do it
  • Fluent in English (written and spoken); German is a plus

Nice-to-Haves

  • Experience recruiting for technical roles (developers, engineers)
  • Knowledge of German employment law and HR compliance
  • Experience in fintech or regulated industries

Benefits

  • Competitive salary
  • Equity/stock options - you'll own part of what we're building
  • On-site in Berlin-Kreuzberg, with flexible remote work as you see fit
  • Significant impact and growth opportunity - help build a company from 5 to 30+ people and grow your role alongside it
  • Autonomy and trust - we align on goals, then give you the space to deliver
  • Learning and development - work directly with experienced founders and a high-caliber team

Hiring process (indicative)

  1. Intro call (30 min)
  2. Deep dive with founders
  3. Team conversations & offer
